edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.WorldController
      • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class GameController
extends WorldController
implements com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener
    Gameplay specific controller for the platformer game. You will notice that asset loading is not done with static methods this time. Instance asset loading makes it easier to process our game modes in a loop, which is much more scalable. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. This is the purpose of our AssetState variable; it ensures that multiple instances place nicely with the static assets.

      • getMusic

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music getMusic()

      • preLoadContent

        public void preLoadContent(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
        Preloads the assets for this controller. To make the game modes more for-loop friendly, we opted for nonstatic loaders this time. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. So we have an AssetState that determines the current loading state. If the assets are already loaded, this method will do nothing.
        Overrides:
        preLoadContent in class WorldController
        Parameters:
        manager - Reference to global asset manager.

      • loadContent

        public void loadContent(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
        Load the assets for this controller. To make the game modes more for-loop friendly, we opted for nonstatic loaders this time. However, we still want the assets themselves to be static. So we have an AssetState that determines the current loading state. If the assets are already loaded, this method will do nothing.
        Overrides:
        loadContent in class WorldController
        Parameters:
        manager - Reference to global asset manager.

      • preUpdate

        public boolean preUpdate(float dt)
        Returns whether to process the update loop At the start of the update loop, we check if it is time to switch to a new game mode. If not, the update proceeds normally.
        Overrides:
        preUpdate in class WorldController
        Parameters:
        dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame
        Returns:
        whether to process the update loop

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        The core gameplay loop of this world. This method contains the specific update code for this mini-game. It does not handle collisions, as those are managed by the parent class WorldController. This method is called after input is read, but before collisions are resolved. The very last thing that it should do is apply forces to the appropriate objects.
        Specified by:
        update in class WorldController
        Parameters:
        dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame

      • beginContact

        public void beginContact(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact)
        Callback method for the start of a collision This method is called when we first get a collision between two objects. We use this method to test if it is the "right" kind of collision. In particular, we use it to test if we made it to the win door.
        Specified by:
        beginContact in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener
        Parameters:
        contact - The two bodies that collided

      • endContact

        public void endContact(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact)
        Callback method for the start of a collision This method is called when two objects cease to touch. The main use of this method is to determine when the characer is NOT on the ground. This is how we prevent double jumping.
        Specified by:
        endContact in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener
